title: The Chase viewers outraged as ITV show pulled off air in major schedule shake - up
body_text:
The Chase viewers outraged as ITV show pulled off air in major schedule shake-up
The Chase viewers were left fuming on Tuesday as the popular ITV quiz show was taken off air
The Chase viewers were left outraged as the ITV show was pulled off air in a major schedule shake-up on Tuesday (June 3).
The hit gameshow, which airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV1, was notably absent from tonight's line-up.
Instead, the ITV news was broadcast at 5pm, followed by coverage of the UEFA Women's Nations League match between England and Spain.
The game, which is being held at the RCDE Stadium in Barcelona, kicked at 6pm, with coverage running from 5.30pm to 8.20pm.
Midsomer Murders will then follow with a two-hour episode, which finishes at 10.20pm.
The Chase wasn't the only ITV fixture affected by the match, with Emmerdale also being cut from its usual 7.30pm slot, reports Edinburgh Live.
The fan-favourite soap will return on Wednesday night (June 4) with an hour-long episode at 7pm.
The Chase fans were left frustrated when they went to tune into the gameshow this evening, with many sharing their disapproval on X (formerly Twitter).
"No Chase and Emmerdale today because of women's football, it's a joke," one person wrote.
Another added: "No #TheChase or much at all due to football? Like there's not enough sport on TV already? Switched off."
A third said: "What's going on why is the news on at 5? Where is the Chase??" while another echoed the sentiment: "Why change the whole evening schedule for a football match?"
Meanwhile, other viewers chose to watch The Chase's rival gameshow, Pointless, on BBC One instead.
"#TheChase has been cancelled for football so I'm watching #Pointless. Why does the world have to stop for sport!!" one viewer wrote, while another said: "No #TheChase. Time for #Pointless then."
The popular ITV quiz show, presented by Bradley Walsh, pits a team of top quizzers against four contestants who are aiming to win cash.
The team of expert quizzers, known as the Chasers, includes Shaun Wallace, aka The Dark Destroyer, Jenny Ryan, aka The Vixen, Darragh Ennis, aka The Menace, Mark Labbett, aka The Beast, Anne Hegerty, aka The Governess, and Paul Sinha, aka The Sinnerman.
The Chase airs weekdays on ITV1 at 5pm
